refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: GTypeModule provides a simple implementation of the GTypePlugin interface. The model of GTypeModule is a dynamically loaded module which implements some number of types and interface implementations. When the module is loaded, it registers its types and interfaces using g_type_module_register_type() and g_type_module_add_interface(). As long as any instances of these types and interface implementations are in use, the module is kept loaded. When the types and interfaces are gone, the module may be unloaded. If the types and interfaces become used again, the module will be reloaded.

Keeping track of whether the module should be loaded or not is done by using a use count - it starts at zero, and whenever it is greater than zero, the module is loaded. The use count is maintained internally by the type system, but also can be explicitly controlled by g_type_module_use() and g_type_module_unuse(). Typically, when loading a module for the first type, g_type_module_use() will be used to load it so that it can initialize its types. At some later point, when the module no longer needs to be loaded except for the type implementations it contains, g_type_module_unuse() is called.

GTypeModule does not actually provide any implementation of module loading and unloading. To create a particular module type you must derive from GTypeModule and implement the load and unload functions in GTypeModuleClass.

refsect2.title: struct GTypeModule
refsect2.para: The members of the GTypeModule structure should not be accessed directly, except for the name field.

refsect2.title: struct GTypeModuleClass
refsect2.para: In order to implement dynamic loading of types based on GTypeModule, the load and unload functions in GTypeModuleClass must be implemented.

listitem.simpara: loads the module and registers one or more types using g_type_module_register_type().

refsect2.title: g_type_module_use ()
refsect2.para: Increases the use count of a GTypeModule by one. If the use count was zero before, the plugin will be loaded.

listitem.simpara: FALSE if the plugin needed to be loaded and loading the plugin failed.

refsect2.title: g_type_module_unuse ()
refsect2.para: Decreases the use count of a GTypeModule by one. If the result is zero, the module will be unloaded. (However, the GTypeModule will not be freed, and types associated with the GTypeModule are not unregistered. Once a GTypeModule is initialized, it must exist forever.)

refsect2.title: g_type_module_set_name ()
refsect2.para: Sets the name for a GTypeModule

listitem.simpara: a human-readable name to use in error messages.

refsect2.title: g_type_module_register_type ()
refsect2.programlisting: GType g_type_module_register_type (GTypeModule *module, GType parent_type, const gchar *type_name, const GTypeInfo *type_info, GTypeFlags flags);
refsect2.para: Looks up or registers a type that is implemented with a particular type plugin. If a type with name type_name was previously registered, the GType identifier for the type is returned, otherwise the type is newly registered, and the resulting GType identifier returned.
When reregistering a type (typically because a module is unloaded then reloaded, and reinitialized), module and parent_type must be the same as they were previously.
As long as any instances of the type exist, the type plugin will not be unloaded.

listitem.simpara: the type for the parent class
flags field providing details about the type
the new or existing type ID

refsect2.title: g_type_module_add_interface ()
refsect2.programlisting: void g_type_module_add_interface (GTypeModule *module, GType instance_type, GType interface_type, const GInterfaceInfo *interface_info);
refsect2.para: Registers an additional interface for a type, whose interface lives in the given type plugin. If the interface was already registered for the type in this plugin, nothing will be done.
As long as any instances of the type exist, the type plugin will not be unloaded.

listitem.simpara: type to which to add the interface.

listitem.para: Portable mechanism for dynamically loaded modules.
